oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hill's Chapel AME Church: front view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hill's Chapel African Methodist Episcopal Church

Color photograph of church front. The gabled church is composed of concrete blocks. Vestibule contains double doors. Shingles comprise the top half of the entrance's facade and the main building's facade. The church building is in poorly maintained condition.

Hill's Chapel AME Church dates from at least the 1920s. Rev. Robert Gardner served as the pastor in 1980. At the time of fieldwork, the church building was in a state of disrepair and no longer utilized as a meeting space.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee;
gable roofs; concrete;
